sentences.english: Marianne was going to retort, but she remembered her promises and forbore.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗安正想反駁，但她記起了自己的諾言，便。

sentences.english: Her lips were sealed by a promise.
Sometimes people don't understand the promises that they're making when they make them.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，人們許諾時並沒有真懂自己許的諾言。

sentences.english: She is always hardworking and she always keeps her promise.
sentences.chinese: 她總用功，她總是保持她的諾言。

sentences.english: It seems out of harmony, someway, with the beauty and promise of the day.
sentences.chinese: 似乎出和諧，好歹，與美麗的諾言一天。

sentences.english: I released him from his promise.
A promise, the preservation period and a few years.
sentences.chinese: 醞釀着的諾言，保存期又有幾年。

sentences.english: If there is one thing that annoys me, it’s people who don’t keep their promises.
sentences.chinese: 如果有什麼使我惱火的話，那就是不遵守諾言的人。

sentences.english: We shall have to pin him down to his promise.
sentences.chinese: 我們將只好迫使他履行諾言。

sentences.english: Gail kept her word and returned all the money.
sentences.chinese: 蓋爾履行了她的諾言，把錢如數歸還。

sentences.english: Then, cacique abides by a promise, put them.
sentences.chinese: 於是，酋長遵守諾言，放了他們。

sentences.english: It's a crime that some people don't carry out their promises.
sentences.chinese: 那些不履行諾言的人是可恥的。

sentences.english: Jack kept his word and attended Mr. Belser's funeral.
sentences.chinese: 傑克履行了他的諾言，參加了貝爾瑟先生的葬禮。

sentences.english: In fact, they may not deliver at all.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，他們或許根本不會履行諾言。

sentences.english: Keep your promise, his first heart is the wind.
sentences.chinese: 信守自己的諾言，是風臣人最初的本心。

sentences.english: One must honor his contract and keep his word.
sentences.chinese: 任何人都應當尊重合同，信守諾言。

definition: to be determined to/to insist on
honor does not allow one to glance back (idiom); duty-bound not to turn back/no surrender/to pursue justice with no second thoughts
to erase/to cover traces/to obliterate evidence/to expunge/to blot out/to suppress
lit. look into one's heart, no shame (idiom); with a clear conscience
to dash on bravely with no thought of personal safety (idiom); undaunted by dangers/regardless of perils
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
lit. scattered ashes and dispersed smoke (idiom)/fig. to be annihilated/to vanish in a puff of smoke
to vanish like smoke in thin air/to disappear
in the right and self-confident (idiom); bold and confident with justice on one's side/to have the courage of one's convictions/just and forceful
